p: Tea tree oil (TTO), an essential oil from Melaleuca alternifolia (Maiden & Betche) Cheel (Myrtaceae), has been known for its antimicrobial and anti-inflammatory effects. TTO consists of about 100 different components including terpinen-4-ol, which is one of its main antibacterial compounds [ 6]. Drugs and care products containing TTO are frequently used for the treatment of various infections or as antiseptics and disinfectants [ 6]. Preliminary clinical trials have demonstrated the efficacy of TTO in the elimination of methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) [ 6]. Previous studies demonstrated the antimicrobial activity of TTO against S. aureus [ 7, 8] and, therefore, this oil was widely adopted in the pharmaceutical industry and in the clinic [ 9]. S. aureus is able to form complex structures named biofilms. Bacteria in biofilms exhibit more resistance to antibiotics and host defense systems, which contribute to its pathogenesis and make the treatment of infections difficult [ 10].
